content: [juno] Wall of night? The dredge?
[serpent] Because of you! Who are you to take my destiny? What are you?!
[serpent] But I cannot.
[serpent] Dead? How is that... are you a god? No.
[serpent] Do you ask the hammer what the blacksmith is making?
[serpent] Do you not recognize me?
[serpent] Do you truly not know?
[serpent] Dredge? Stone men marching across a long bridge? No. It is darkness.
[serpent] Frustrating.
[serpent] I am incomplete! A worm crawling through a dung field!
[serpent] I am meant to devour the tapestry itself, not idly witness the dusk smother this rock.
[serpent] I am the end. Do you understand? This world, and this tapestry, I would devour. It is my purpose.
[serpent] If you are not going to die, I suppose we must speak instead.
[serpent] Inconvenient.
[serpent] Instead, now comes a wall of night to consume your pitiful world.
[serpent] Is there no child coming to slay me with a magic sword? Are there no stars in the sky foretelling this disaster?
[serpent juno] Do you truly not know?

content.option: I have no idea what you are talking about
I will know if you tell me

content: [serpent juno] What are you? What is your purpose?

content.option: First, tell me what you are

content: [serpent juno] Who are you?
[serpent] Listen carefully, thief. I will give you a prophecy to write on banners and tomes.
[serpent] Listen carefully, for I will give you a prophecy worth writing on banners and tomes.
[serpent] Listen carefully now, for I will give you a prophecy.
[serpent] Mender? Ah, Valka. Now the picture is forming. Do you not know me, Valka?
[serpent] Must I tell you what you are?
[serpent] Must the prophecy speak of itself, then? So be it.
[serpent] Perhaps you miss the meaning. What I wish to know does matter. Hmm.
[serpent] /=Return what is mine!=/
[serpent] The egg white that has turned black.
[serpent] The gods are silent and before me stands one who knows not what they have done.
[serpent] Then I will give you a prophecy worth writing on banners and tomes.
[serpent] This conversation becomes more meaningless by the word.
[serpent] True, perhaps, but whether you are simple or clever remains to be seen. A different question, then.
[serpent] What are you? What is your purpose?
[serpent] What do your prophecies say? The gods gave you prophecy. Fate. Destiny.
[serpent] Who are you?
[serpent] You are a Juno? It means nothing to me.
[serpent] You are a Juno? It means nothing to me. Maybe I have asked the wrong question.
[serpent] You are a thief. You have something that does not belong to you. It is mine.
{skip} mark1=serpent mark2=juno
/=Though your memory is still fuzzy, you're certain you know nothing about an enormous serpent.=/
/=You are slow to understand the serpent. It speaks in a language that recalls very ancient memories of words you learned long ago.=/
